document: Chapter 4: Text Mining and Text Analytics - Fundamentals of Data Science

questions.question: Text mining combines language science, computer science, statistics, and machine learning.
Text mining turns unstructured text into a more structured form.
Facebook's autocomplete feature does not use named entity recognition.
Google uses text mining only for answering search queries, not for other purposes.
About 85-90% of all corporate data is in some kind of unstructured form.
Unstructured corporate data doubles in size every 5 years.
Text mining is also known as knowledge discovery in textual databases.
Data mining and text mining both seek novel and useful patterns.
The main difference between data mining and text mining is that data mining works with unstructured data.
Text mining first imposes structure on data, then mines the structured data.
Text mining has applications in law, medicine, finance, and marketing.
Spam filtering is not an application of text mining.
Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a subfield of artificial intelligence.
The 'bag of words' approach considers the order and structure of words.
Syntax refers to the arrangement of words to form a sentence.
Semantics refers to the study of meaning.
WordNet is an automatically generated database of English words.
Sentiment analysis detects favorable and unfavorable opinions toward products.
SentiWordNet is not related to sentiment analysis.
The text mining process consists of three steps.
Step 1 of text mining is to create the Term-by-Document Matrix.
The corpus includes all relevant unstructured data like documents, emails, and web pages.
Stop words should always be included in text analysis.
Stemming reduces words to their root form.
Binary frequencies count how many times a term appears in a document.
Inverse document frequency gives more weight to terms that appear in many documents.
Term-by-Document Matrix has terms as rows and documents as columns.
Classification and clustering are techniques for extracting patterns in text mining.
Text mining cannot improve search recall or precision.
Query-specific clustering is not a text mining application.
Trend analysis can be performed using text mining.
Plagiarism detection is an application of text mining.
Automatic text summarization is not possible with text mining.
Text mining is only useful for English language text.
NLP studies the understanding of natural human language.
The 'bag of words' approach is a new method in text mining.
WordNet includes definitions, synonyms, and semantic relations between words.
Email prioritization and categorization use text mining techniques.
Text mining cannot be used for fraud detection.
The three-step text mining process ends with establishing the corpus.
